name: professoryes
text: Disgusted with how low he's fallen, Cornelius ends another empty novel.

name: prolefeed5
text: Yeah, he seems somewhat disconsolate and lugubrious in this one...

name: jthompson
text: It's no more shameful than writing the closed captioning for porn.

name: professoryes
text:
In theory, but at least he could console himself with knowing that the deaf are experiencing good quality pornographic narration.

Here, well...

name: zefiel
text: A comment left by zefiel was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by SchnappM, Jhunter, equinn2006, Cane_5, AtlanticCity)

name: jack
text: A comment left by jack was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Zefiel, Spoon, Vondicus, clembot, henrythecad)

name: robobogle
text: A comment left by robobogle was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Zefiel, littlecat, SchnappM, jesupocalypse)

name: zefiel
text: A comment left by zefiel was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by sirhan_duran, apocowarg, Unfun, SchnappM, Ravenmancer, rowboat, Jhunter, equinn2006, RobAngry, Fcannon, Epicurus, anitrophaeron, slalvation)

name: prolefeed5
text: Woah, no need for everyone to get all irascible and splenetic...

name: invidious
text: I am anaspeptic, phrasmotic, even compunctious to have caused you such periconbobulations.

name: subactuality
text: I think I'm going to try reading Cornelius' lines in this voice from now on.  I expect it to be only intermittently disappointing.

name: johnnyrocker
text:
Yeah but the thing is that you didn't get the reference.
What you said was clever, to be sure, but it wasn't quite as "on the ball" as jack's comment.

name: cheapcynicism
text:
>>You're losing your perspicacity.<<

Well, it's always in the last place you look.

name: nigelchaos
text: Well.. once you've found it... there's no further need to look.

name: boredom_man
text: You've confused your perspicacity with your house keys.

name: enough_talk
text: And HEY, who stole the perspicacity???

name: ashoykh
text: As opposed to synonyms to a different word?

name: killerlimpet
text: As opposed to synonyms to each other, I imagine. Is synonymity transitive?

name: yomimono
text: If you assume it is, you can get to "walrus and apple are synonyms" without too much effort.

name: killerlimpet
text: show me.

name: homeskool
text: I don't think you thought that through. Saying "hey, if synonyms are transitive I can get walrus and apple to be synonyms kinda quick like" is like saying "hey, let's play Six Degrees of Cartilage Head without liquefying our brains in the process".

name: fishies
text: That is some insane Achewood reference powers you have there... INSANE! I'm takin those chubbies up to 13.

name: mikeleffel2
text: Lord, the imagery. Beautiful.

name: twotonturkey
text: I like how Cornelius shamefully looks over his shoulder, as if the Pulitzer judges might be sneaking up on him.

name: unfun
text: Cornelius has a wide variance of eyebrows.

name: chuvak
text: More than that, they vanish, then reapper, as if going for a short while to check out another dimension where he doesn't have to write novels like this for money.

name: contrasoma
text: Gates seems the perfect sort to pitch this new venture to. Lord knows he doesn't get much validation elsewhere .

name: carageenan
text:
you seen this yet?
http://www.nbc11.com/news/13889730/detail.html

name: contrasoma
text: I hadn't!  Very interesting, thanks.  Too bad it wasn't enough to net him the Nobel this time around.

name: otter
text:
"Pynchon was born in 1937. Other notable works include V., Gravity's Rainbow, Vineland and Mason & Dixon, according to the book's back cover."

wow, way to do research, NBC!

name: hereward
text: I love how the guys who cracked it initially went out that evening with the intention to score, and ended up solving corporate symbol-code. Beautifully nerdy.

name: son_of_selleck
text: A comment left by son_of_selleck was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by mike24, michellemarie, whoppin, domini, Lereya, Jork)

name: divot
text: Chubbied, for your Howard-Moon-esque assessment of the situation.

name: madnes
text: Chubbied for *your* gratuitous Boosh reference.

name: lereya
text:
Anyone who has ever written fanfiction knows the gambit
of emotions that Cornelius is going through, evidenced by his eyebrows.

Creation
Dedication
Pride
Identification
Shame.

name: m1st3rbl4ck
text:
the gamut, perhaps? or even gauntlet.

...

name: pierceg
text: He meant gambit.

name: pierceg
text: She*

name: chuvak
text: NO. GAMBIT. Like, the X-Man.

name: luckyg
text: A comment left by luckyg was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dovey, nighttoad, pitseleh)

name: selbencoirlo
text:
But they're great for blowing up hats!
And... and card tables?

name: pie4me6
text: Exploding playing cards

name: pie4me6
text: First BBcode attempt is a success!

name: lereya
text: I was, admittedly, drunk.  But I like gambit.  I want to hurt people with playing cards.  It was totally Freudian.

name: chuvak
text: Hells yes. Who doesn't?

name: boredom_man
text: I want to kill people if I touch them for too long. Wanna have a relationship that is neither platonic nor sexual and makes fanfic-writers weep?

name: selbencoirlo
text: I actually have that power; I kill people if I touch them too long, too hard, in the face or body. It is both blessing and curse.

name: werthog42
text: A comment left by werthog42 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by robotman, ninjaDance, Lereya, Nictusempra)

name: dr_manflesh_desires_anal_play_immediately
text: you missed one: "Posting it on Acheworld" comes right before "Pride"

name: lereya
text: I'm not allowed to give you a Chubby.  But I would.  Oh, how I would.

name: domini
text: THE MAN IS SO OLD SCHOOL, HE USES A TYPEWRITER THAT GOES "TING!"

name: domini
text: all due to a miniature gothic style bell attached to the "return key"

name: augeno13
text: what return key?

name: domini
text: You see? So old school they replaced the actual keys the bear uses with new ones on modern day typewriter machines.

name: downwithnow
text: A comment left by downwithnow was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dovey, odei, domini)

name: domini
text:
You're trying way too hard.

And Napoleon was classy. He had a legacy .

name: killingthejay
text:
"i'm gonna go draw boobs on the etch-a-sketch!"
"go ahead, they always turn out square!"

name: elzilcho
text: MEANWHILE: Todd does coke and listens to seven Grateful Dead albums at once. His life is screwed up pretty bad. He doesn't have a lot of options.

name: peterjoel
text: Todd? Who's Todd?

name: javonathan
text: First the typewriter goes CLING, then afterwards it goes TING

name: lucas
text:
Yours was the very last comment made before I got on to point out the very same thing. I think we should work for those shitty books written for assholes that point out all the inconsistencies in movies and such.

"When Indiana Jones and gang are racing the Nazis to the canyon of the Crescent Moon, Indy looks at the Nazi convoy with binoculars. Close-ups of Indy show the sun is clearly behind him, and the binoculars are in his shadow. But then a glare from the lens alerts the Nazis to their presence."

name: rogergs
text:
"When Jobs drops the Etch-a-Sketch and scrambles to his feet, the impact would have erased the drawing."

BY JOVE HOLMES

name: jthompson
text:
It's an IEtch-a-Sketch.

Oh, what? Your Etch-a-Sketch doesn't have that feature? At least you can still compose emails and browse the internet with it, right?

Ohhh, you bought an IEtch-a-Sketch knock off, didn't you?

name: chuvak
text: man, maybe the typewriter goes cling when a brother hits tab, and ting when a brother hits return.

name: ricnine
text: Yep, that last panel is definitely shame bordering on self-loathing. It's okay, Mr. Bear; we still love you.

name: lereya
text: Self-loathing looks like shame, but with alcohol.  We still love you, Mr. Bear, indeed.

name: morelaak
text:
this is so perfect on so many levels....
...and that's coming from me, a mac user.

of course, i'm looking at it in a different way. Gates is too caught up in the complexities of the world to pick up on the simpler things in life, like Steve Jobs (sic).

name: prine
text: Think Different.

name: happycat
text: A comment left by happycat was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by PierceG, EvilChick, rowboat, CEOKasen)

name: morelaak
text:
ok, i don't think you quite got me there.....

i meant Steve Jobs is a simpler thing in life.

C'mon guys, get your latin words used for ridicule and irony straight...

name: zedpower
text: In the next chapter, Steve Jobs is crying and promising a broken egg that it will still be a chicken someday.

name: pyromancer
text: In five more paragaphs the sandwich fixin's will be all over the damn floor.

name: geysershitdick
text: The Segway is really more of a Wozniak thing.

name: tekende
text: Maybe, but what stands out for me about that is that Jobs somehow managed to make the Segway go UP THE STAIRS.

name: kingsleymc
text: Zzzzz...

name: jordstar
text: Bill Gates fan fiction is all very well and rad. But I dread Achewood fan fiction. I think Achewood fans are reverent enough that they would never try.

name: barthexderosa
text:
None of this matters, because Jobs had the plucky, boyish Noah Wyle play him in the made-for-TV movie, while Gates had the scary post-steriodal meatgeek Anthony Michael Hall.

Advantage: Jobs

name: norrin
text: A comment left by norrin was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, GSurge, robotman)

name: norrin
text: I think poeple may have misunderstood what I meant. I said he's uninterested because in the previous comic he clearly showed that he did not care for the topic. I didn't mean the writing sucked.

name: luckyg
text: Oh, I just thought you meant he was pleasuring himself to keep his spirits up.

name: victorsmonster
text: What is genius is how the line spacing is tighter in panel 3, reflecting the frenetic pace of the narrative.

name: straw
text: Pretty sure that's just a way to fit more text in the frame.

name: victorsmonster
text: can't we both be right ?!

name: talix18
text: HUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUGS!

name: nbgreene
text: fukuda has been in office for two weeks... i guess getting a mahogany desk into bill gates' office was one of his first orders of business.  makes sense really.

name: neonfreon
text: Cornelius is Fake Bill Gates.

name: bourbonsamurai
text:
Does anyone else have trouble seeing the entire alt text? Mine says "it's kind of like Silver Spoons, where the dad lets the kid do whatever they want because it..."
Or does it end there and I just don't understand?

name: boredom_man
text: Right-click on picture. Choose "Properties." Highlight the Alt-text to scroll through it. Alternatively, "...it can't hurt the dad."

name: robotman
text:
Are you running Firefox? There's a plugin that fixes that, and gets all the alt text to display:
https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/1933

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Sweet. Thanks!

name: asumoactingbig
text: A comment left by asumoactingbig was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Pox, silver_lake, rowboat, prius_chaser, atticusonline, vodkavonstroheim, behka, rachel, domini)

name: rowboat
text: tongue all wavin' behind him as he runs all saliva flyin' and gettin' on the priceless renoir

name: retinarow
text: Bread is almost always upset by Steve Jobs. He makes it feel really self-conscious.

name: tristanhw
text: I opened this in firefox and the tab up the top said "Bill gates fan fiction" :(

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Ray: Finally Airborne!

name: i_love_kate
text: Ray has been in the airport for five weeks. He is "plussed" by the service.

name: schmonday
text:
It's so bad he can't even look at it, like a puppy pooping on the carpet.
"Don't do it fan-fiction, no! Bad paper! Bad! No...awww, it's finished. Now I got to clean up a mess."
